Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has fined Hawthorne, Calif.-based Space Exploration Technologies, Inc., - also known as SpaceX - $45,600 for violating hazardous waste requirements of the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Los Angeles
Private Litigation Case Title: Joseph A. Smith v.?Space Exploration Technologies Corp.;  Stan Saporito v. Space Exploration Technologies Corp.;  and Sebring Whitaker v.? Space Exploration Technologies Corp.

Info Source: Contained in a spreadsheet received from the agency on October 2, 2020 in response to an open records request. The spreadsheet included data from  the agency's Oculus database, which can be searched at https://prodenv.dep.state.fl.us/DepNexus/public/searchPortal
Notes: Case number is the designation given by the DEP's Office of General Counsel.
